sense.def:
To be sure about something
pomeni verjeti, da je nekaj zanesljivo res, in ne dvomiti v to.

seg.quote: I'm not quite sure but I think it's half past five.
The only thing we're sure about is that it's a boy.
Are you sure you won't have another drink?

sense.def:
To be sure of oneself
pomeni biti zelo samozavesten glede svojih zmožnosti ali mnenj.

To be sure of getting something
pomeni trdno verjeti, da bomo nekaj dobili.

seg.quote: We can be sure of success.
You could not always be sure of winning.

sense.def:
Kadar nekaj
is sure to happen
, se bo prav gotovo zgodilo.

seg.quote: He was sure to see her again.
We're sure to get a place.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
sure
opišemo postopek ali sistem, ki nikoli ne odpove ali je točen.

seg.quote: Wood dust beneath a piece of furniture is a sure sign of woodworm.
She had a sure grasp of the subject.

sense.def:
Izraz
sure
se v pogovornem jeziku uporablja kot pritrdilnica namesto
yes
.

seg.quote: You sure do have an interesting job.

sense.def:
To make sure about something
pomeni preverjati nekaj ali ukrepati tako, da zanesljivo izvemo, da je res narejeno.

seg.quote: He glanced over his shoulder to make sure that there was nobody listening.

sense.def:
Kadar rečemo, da je nekaj res
for sure
ali da nekaj vemo
for sure
, hočemo povedati, da je tisto nedvomno res ali da se bo nedvomno zgodilo;

seg.quote: One thing was for sure, there was nothing wrong with Allen's eyesight.

sense.def:
Z izrazom
sure enough
potrdimo, da je nekaj res.

seg.quote: ‘The baby's crying,’ she said. Sure enough, a yelling noise was coming from upstairs.
